text: Inhibition of nuclear factor kappaB activation attenuates apoptosis resistance in lymphoid cells .

Death - inducing ligands ( DILs ) such as <extra_id_0> tumor necrosis factor alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) or the cytotoxic drug doxorubicin have been shown to activate a nuclear factor kappaB ( NFkappaB ) - dependent program that may rescue cells from apoptosis induction .

We demonstrate here that <extra_id_0> TRAIL <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> TNF-related apoptosis-inducing ligand <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , a recently identified DIL , also activates NFkappaB in lymphoid cell lines in a kinetic similar to <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
NFkappaB activity is independent from <extra_id_0> FADD <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , caspases , and apoptosis induction .

To study the influence of NFkappaB activity on apoptosis mediated by <extra_id_0> TRAIL <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> CD95 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , or doxorubicin , NFkappaB activation was inhibited using the proteasome inhibitor N - acetyl-L-leucinyl-L-leucinyl-L-norleucinal or transient overexpression of mutant <extra_id_0> IkappaBalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Gene_expression overexpression <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme IkappaBalpha <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Positive_regulation overexpression <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme overexpression <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: Sensitivity for induction of apoptosis was markedly increased by these treatments in apoptosis sensitive cell lines .

Moreover , both in cell lines and in primary leukemia cells that are resistant towards induction of apoptosis by DILs and doxorubicin , antagonization of NFkappaB activity partially restored apoptosis sensitivity .
These data suggest that inhibition of NFkappaB activation may provide a molecular approach to increase apoptosis sensitivity in anticancer treatment .
